name: nasally
content:

in a way that relates to the nose or is done through the nose: They are best known as the maker of a nasally inhaled flu vaccine. Dmitri was breathing nasally.
usually disapproving If someone speaks nasally, their voice has a particular sound because air is going through the nose when they speak: Mr Smith droned on nasally. He plays the character with a high-pitched, nasally projected voice. See
nasal
More examplesFewer examplesThese drugs are active taken orally or nasally.A more costly flu vaccine that is administered nasally also is available.She experiments vocally: wailing nasally like Axl Rose, or rapping huskily.
